maml:description.maml:para: Get general information about a PDF Document.

Returns PDF document metadata. Supports inspecting encrypted documents but if multiple documents are provided at once (e.g. using wildcards), all encrypted documents must use the same password. Information returned is unaffected by whether the user or owner password is provided.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get document information for an encrypted document.
Get document information for all documents in the working directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Get user permissions for encrypted PDF document.
Show current permissions for PDF documents. These permissions restrict access to limit what non-owners can do with the document.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get document security options for "file1.pdf" encrypted with password "test123".

maml:description.maml:para: Combine multiple PDF documents into a single output.
Join multiple PDF documents to produce a single output document. Source files are combined in the order they are given at the command line. All files must be unencrypted.
Array of input documents to merge, processed in order they are given.
Array of input documents to merge, processed in order they are given.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Join-PDFDocument -SourceDocuments file1.pdf, file2.pdf, file3.pdf -OutputDocument output.pdf

dev:remarks.maml:para: Combine 3 source files into a single output

maml:description.maml:para: Update metadata for PDF documents, including Title, Author etc.
Name of application which originally created document.
Name of application which originally created document.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Change document author for "file1.pdf" to "Bob Smith".

command:example.maml:title: --------------------- Set document subject ---------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-PDFDocumentInformation -Document file1.pdf -Subject "A PDF Document"

maml:description.maml:para: Set rotation of one or more PDF pages. Rotation angle can be provided relative to the current page rotation or as an absolute rotation from the original rotation from when the page was created. Rotation angles are given in degrees, must be a multiple of 90 and are treated as clockwise.
Angle of rotation. Must be a multiple of 90.
Whether rotation value given is an absolute value or relative to the current page rotation.
Whether rotation value given is an absolute value or relative to the current page rotation.
Angle of rotation. Must be a multiple of 90.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Rotate the second page of file1.pdf 90 degrees clockwise.
Rotate the second, third and seventh pages of file1.pdf 90 degrees clockwise.
Rotate pages 4 to 10 of file1.pdf 90 degrees anticlockwise.
Set all pages back to their default rotation.

maml:description.maml:para: Owner Password, required to modify permissions. Will default to user password if left blank.
User Password, required to open the PDF.
Owner Password, required to modify permissions. Will default to user password if left blank.
User Password, required to open the PDF.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Array of page numbers to extract.
Array of page numbers to extract.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}
